column4: it's not working. When I click on the firefox icon it tells me that i cannot start firefox because it's not responding and already running, i must either restart or else terminate the firefox process
any ideas how i can make firefox work again?
without restarting?
I keep getting this message: Firefox is already running but is not responding. To open a new window you must terminate the existing process or restart your system.
Any ideas? Once this happened and someone in here knew what to type.
great idea!
the fastest way to fix that without the terminal is CTRL+Alt+backspace
could you connect it to the internet and download the install directly to it?
I just stuck an old nic card into it.. but how would I download directly to it for install? I'm missing something.
I thought if you could download the whole cd to the hard drive, then you could use that.
no that won't work.. there would be no way to boot to the installer..
- could you put it on many many floppies?
I would like to know how you are supposed to install Ubuntu on this machine. Let me know when you find out.
this one --- http://www.instantfundas.com/2007/08/install-any-linux-distro-directly-from.html
I'm reading this link .. sounds interesting.  http://tinyurl.com/3exghs
But someone won't likely have a separate home partition unless they set that up on a previous install.
true.. but you can make one and copy you stuff over before upgrading..
You stop.
Stop highlighting me in this channel when I did not even know you were in this channel.
Highlighting me in a channel that I did not even know you are in is rude. Please don't speak to me.
funny you should say that since you've been pm-ing me for that last 3 minutes..
What does that have to do with the veracity of my comment?
